DataElement.preferredName: Prior EGFR Therapy Other Than EGFRvIII Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the patient received prior therapy of an EGFR inhibitor other than EGFRvIII vaccine.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor Therapeutic Procedure Negation EGFRvIII Peptide Vaccine Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._The protein found on the surface of some cells and to which epidermal growth factor binds, causing the cells to divide. It is found at abnormally high levels on the surface of many types of cancer cells, so these cells may divide excessively in the presence of epidermal growth factor._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._An antineoplastic vaccine directed against a peptide found in the epidermal growth factor receptor class III variant (EGFRvIII), a constitutively activated mutant of the wild-type tyrosine kinase. This protein variant is present in a substantial proportion of malignant gliomas and other human cancers._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Prior Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor Therapeutic Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The protein found on the surface of some cells and to which epidermal growth factor binds, causing the cells to divide. It is found at abnormally high levels on the surface of many types of cancer cells, so these cells may divide excessively in the presence of epidermal growth factor.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Epidermal growth factor receptor (1210 aa, ~134 kDa) is encoded by the human EGFR gene. This protein plays a role in cell-cell adhesion, cell migration, cell proliferation and signal transduction.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Negation EGFRvIII Peptide Vaccine Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:An antineoplastic vaccine directed against a peptide found in the epidermal growth factor receptor class III variant (EGFRvIII), a constitutively activated mutant of the wild-type tyrosine kinase. This protein variant is present in a substantial proportion of malignant gliomas and other human cancers.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

An antineoplastic vaccine directed against a peptide found in the epidermal growth factor receptor class III variant (EGFRvIII), a constitutively activated mutant of the wild-type tyrosine kinase. This protein variant is present in a substantial proportion of malignant gliomas and other human cancers.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for ABTC 1302 as requested by J.Zhao.  mc 7/12/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If the patient had prior ther
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient had prior therapy with EGFR inhibitors, did the patient receive any other type of EGFR inhibitor other than EGFRvIII vaccine?

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for ABTC-1302 study in Rave per request by J.Zhao. mc 7/12/16
